radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild bibasilar atelectasis; bases of lungs are clear; no discrete nodule, consolidation, or pleural effusion; liver normal; no focal hepatic lesions; gallbladder normal; spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands normal; multiple medullary calcifications consistent with history of medullary sponge kidney; appendix enlarged, measuring up to 12 mm; minimal surrounding stranding; trace free fluid in pelvis; no evidence of appendiceal perforation
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Appendix was air filled and normal appearing on prior exam, now enlarged.
